messages.messageBody:
I've added four photos of this sword to Yahoo photos for anyone interested in looking. My folder "Ron STL"...

http://ph.groups.yahoo.com/group/nihonto/photos/browse/c656?c=

http://tinyurl.com/q4uz2



Ron
STL

messages.subject: Boys sword...
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Rich - No, I don t recall seeing those at Choshuya but then my aging brain was on its way to overload at that time.  I kind of figure quality is quality
messages.messageBody:
Hi Rich -

No, I don't recall seeing those at Choshuya but then my aging brain was on its way to overload at that time. I kind of figure "quality is quality" and if it exists, enjoy and appreciate it. I'll be curious is there was ever an article written about these miniatures. My friend (trained as a goldsmith) seems to think one seppa is solid gold which if so, would indicate something.

Ron
STL

----- Original Message -----
From: Richard Turner
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, February 25, 2007 3:54 PM
Subject: Re: [SPAM] [nihontostudy] Boys sword...


I don;t know a lot about them ( or swords for that matter ) Ron but
while in Japan last October ( you were there as well so you may have
seen them ) there were 2 nice examples of boys swords in Choshuya Ginza,
just inside the main entrance on the right. I seem to remember one of
them being rather good. They may have just been Koshirae, the grey
matter is fading :-)

Rich

Ron Hartmann wrote:
>
> Hi all -
>
> Quiet weekend. Thought I'd ask if anyone knows of any factual articles
> or simply some background information on those miniature "Boys swords"
> that we sometimes see from time to time. Some of these appear pretty
> low-end quality while on occasion, some real workmanship shows up.
>
> Personally, I've never had much interest in these but recently, a very
> nice quality one was brought to me here in St. Louis by an antique
> appraiser friend. Now I own it. What impressed me was the nice quality
> of the fittings, the baleen wrapping and a very handsome, well forged
> blade. The blade appears to be signed Bizen Osafune Morimitsu and is
> dated Oei 5 but more likely, from what I've gathered, it is more
> likely a shinshinto creation made as a Morimitsu. Hamon is a narrow
> suguha with ko-nei with a boshi swept in ko-nie (hakikake). Bo hi and
> an extended kissaki, male/female mekugi with "mellon" crest. Quite a
> nice "package" as we say.
>
> I've been told some of these were for export, but others were indeed
> made for presentation during coming-of-age. It would seem that
> somebody would know more detail about these swords or perhaps know of
> an authoritative article on them somewhere.
>
> Ron
> STL

messages.subject: Boys sword...
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all - Quiet weekend. Thought I d ask if anyone knows of any factual articles or simply some background information on those miniature Boys swords that we
messages.messageBody:
Hi all -

Quiet weekend. Thought I'd ask if anyone knows of any factual articles or simply some background information on those miniature "Boys swords" that we sometimes see from time to time. Some of these appear pretty low-end quality while on occasion, some real workmanship shows up.

Personally, I've never had much interest in these but recently, a very nice quality one was brought to me here in St. Louis by an antique appraiser friend. Now I own it. What impressed me was the nice quality of the fittings, the baleen wrapping and a very handsome, well forged blade. The blade appears to be signed Bizen Osafune Morimitsu and is dated Oei 5 but more likely, from what I've gathered, it is more likely a shinshinto creation made as a Morimitsu. Hamon is a narrow suguha with ko-nei with a boshi swept in ko-nie (hakikake). Bo hi and an extended kissaki, male/female mekugi with "mellon" crest. Quite a nice "package" as we say.

I've been told some of these were for export, but others were indeed made for presentation during coming-of-age. It would seem that somebody would know more detail about these swords or perhaps know of an authoritative article on them somewhere.

Ron
STL

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
